title: Finding the slope
text: The first thing we want to do is rewrite the equations so that both equations are in slope-intercept form and we can find the slopes.

title: Relationship between slopes and graphs
text: Parallel lines have the same slope and different y-intercepts. Two lines are perpendicular if the product of the two slopes is $$-1$$.
speech: Parallel lines have the same slope and different y-intercepts. Two lines are perpendicular if the product of the two slopes is  minus 1 .

title: Determining Whether the Lines are Parallel, Perpendicular, or Neither
text: Since $$\frac{3}{2}=\frac{3}{2}$$, the graphs of these two lines are parallel.
